text: Parliamentary elections were held in Laos on 18 August 1951.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p135 Unlike previous elections, which had been held on a non- partisan basis,Nohlen et al., p137 this one saw political parties compete for the first time. The result was a victory for the National Progressive Party, which won 19 of the 39 seats. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text- align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats |- |align=left|National Progressive Party|| || ||19 |- |align=left|Independent Party|| || ||10 |- |align=left|Democratic Party|| || ||4 |- |align=left|Lao National Union Party|| || ||2 |- |align=left|Independents|| || ||4 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||–||– |- |align=left|Total|| || ||39 |- |colspan=4 align=left|Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Category:1951 elections in Asia Category:Elections in Laos Category:1951 in Laos
title: 1951 Laotian parliamentary election
